meanings.definition: To press or squeeze with force
meanings.sent1: She crushed the can with her foot.
meanings.sent2: The wrestler crushed his opponent in the match.
meanings.sent3: The little girl crushed the playdough into funny shapes.
meanings.sent4: The weight of the world crushed down on his shoulders.
meanings.sent5: The car crusher crushed the old vehicles into small metal cubes.

meanings.sent1: The army crushed the enemy forces in battle.
meanings.sent2: The final exam crushed her hopes of passing the class.
meanings.sent3: His dance moves crushed the competition at the talent show.
meanings.sent4: The storm crushed the fragile sandcastle on the beach.
meanings.sent5: The news of the loss crushed their spirits.

meanings.definition: Broken or shattered by being pressed or squeezed
meanings.sent1: The crushed cookies were still delicious.
meanings.sent2: The crushed glass glittered in the sunlight.
meanings.sent3: The crushed box looked like it had been sat on.
meanings.sent4: The crushed ice cooled the drink quickly.
meanings.sent5: The crushed petals released a sweet fragrance.

meanings.sent1: He felt crushed when his artwork was criticized.
meanings.sent2: She was crushed when her friends didn't invite her to the party.
meanings.sent3: The team was crushed after losing the championship game.
meanings.sent4: His dreams of winning were crushed by the reality of the situation.
meanings.sent5: The student was crushed by the teacher's harsh words.
